thread.title: 360-degree video of N.Korea takes you where few have gone before (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: 360-degree video of N.Korea takes you where few have gone before (VIDEO)

title: 360-degree video of N.Korea takes you where few have gone before (VIDEO)
text:
360-degree video of N.Korea takes you where few have gone before (VIDEO) Friday July 24, 2015 Print Article 
SINGAPORE, July 24 — Singaporean freelance photographer Aram Pan has created the first 360-degree video of the world’s most secretive nation: North Korea. 
This video contains excerpts from Pan’s tour through the northeastern parts of North Korea and covers Rason, Namyang, Hoeryon, Chongjin, Kyongson and Chilbo. 
According to The New Paper , the 39-year-old photographer used an Entaniya fisheye lens mounted on a modified GoPro to create his interactive video that allows viewers to pan around — effectively placing them beside Pan on his journey. 
To view more of his work, visit his website at www.dprk360.com or check out his Facebook page at www.facebook.com/dprk360 . 
A 360-degree video by a Singapore photographer offers a rare glimpse of the hermit kingdom. — Screen grab from YouTube More Stories for You:
